title: Executive Order 5567-Power-Site Restoration No. 461, Montana
content: So much of Executive Order of October 14, 1915, creating Power-Site Reserve No. 512, as modified by Order of Modification approved March 14, 1916, as affects the lands hereinafter described, is hereby revoked:

Those portions of the following described subdivisions lying outside of the area within fifty feet of each side of the center fine of the installed pipe fine of the Public Utilities Consolidated Corporation, successor to the Mission Range Power Company, as shown on a map designated J-6, bearing the affidavit of Frank F. Faucett and certificate of J. H. Cline, and filed in the United States Land Office at Kalispell, Montana, on November 5, 1915, with the application of the latter company for a power permit:
[NAME], Sec. 33, NE ¼ SE ¼, S ½ SE ¼.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5567-Power-Site Restoration No. 461, Montana Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361358
